comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: It’s fascinating to see so many dolls in the photograph. I wonder if that was a custom; and was it done just for “picture day”, or did dolls regularly accompany some girls to school. Reading about the Balmain Public School is equally interesting! It dates back to the 1860’s. By 1883, the school enrollment was 1,269 children! (Enrollment for 2012 was 230 students). The Balmain Public School identifies this photo as “Class 2A - 1917”.

comment.author: 90661829@N05
comment._content: I love seeing such old pictures of everyday life, all of their parents were born in the 1800's! astounding to think of it that way. :)

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/90661829@N05] For some reason I find these pics of school kids to have a timeless element...as if the kids are eternal clay, and we're seeing them at a point when they're still being shaped and moulded and socialised...when they're not yet firmly located in a particular time and place...when they might be yesterday's children or today's children...

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/10279281605/] another similar one

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/24785917@N03/2363539264/in/photolist-4ARKSY-4MATxb-4NBQY5-58KE4w-dChqnJ-dCc8TZ-czbJtj-dChx51-czbJfS-czbHCu] sort of similar

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/9610489593/] I love this one too!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pixelwrangler]  We have quite a few class photos from this era in this series. And many of these include toys or educational tools / instruments. It must have been the trend of the day!

comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] I think of that too QM, and grow the idea to further consider that they grew up to be the custodians of Sydney and did their part of shaping it somehow.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: That looks remarkably similar to my 2A photo from 1962

comment.author: 110739163@N07
comment._content:
I attended Balmain Primary School in 1947 and have a photo of our class.  The open window in the background was where
we ordered our lunch, etc. Brings back happy memories
